answerText: Portnoy's Complaint[10] This author wrote about the working class library worker Neil Klugman who falls in love with Brenda Patimkin in Goodbye, Columbus and also wrote Portnoy's Complaint.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 14 - Finals 2 | 16 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The protagonist of this novel has a threesome with his lover, Mary Jane Reed, and the prostitute Lena. For 10 points each: [10] Name this work in which the title character, Alexander, has an Oedipal love for his mother, Sophie, and tells his problems to Dr. Spielvogel.
